page.title: 08Flora
page.content:
Bracken, heather, sand sedge and various grasses dominate the{heath.}In Spring patches of turf between the bracken areas are covered with dozens of species not much more than an inch high ___ sorrel, thyme, chickenweed, forget-me-not, saxifrage, speedwell, cranesbill, candytuft, vetch. The edges of the{arable fields}are white with campion and camomile, and later the edges change colour with poppies, cransebill and bugloss.
{Woodland areas}and ditches have snowdrops and primroses. Open patches of grass are covered with cowslips. In summer the{water meadows}on either side of the river are{full of plants such as willow herb, loosestrife, meadow sweet, hemlock, fleabane, thistle, nettle, and valerian. In the (contd on P 9)
